text: Atari, Inc. is an American video game and home computer company. It was founded in 1972 by Nolan Bushnell and Ted Dabney.Mark J. P. Wolf, The Video Game Explosion: A History from PONG to Playstation and Beyond (Westport, CT: Greenwood Press, 2008), p. 59 Atari was the first company to make a video arcade game in a cabinet. The company made famous games, such as Pong. Atari helped define the gaming entertainment industry and home computers from the 1970s to the mid-1980s. They made home computers until 1993. Atari filed for bankruptcy in 2013https://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2014/06/05/snatching-atari- back-from-the-grave-again/ == References == == Other websites == * The Atari History Museum - Atari historical archive site. * Atari Times, supporting all Atari consoles. * AtariAge.com * Atari Gaming Headquarters - Atari historical archive site. * Atari On Film - List of Atari products in films. * History of Atari from 1978 to 1981 * A History of Syzygy / Atari / Atari Games / Atari Holdings * http://atari.com - Company that manages intellectual property of games and franchises. title: Atari, Inc.
